Annotation.String: A metric Value.
Abstract metric Value.
A set of metrics that are collected periodically.
This resource specifies a set of metrics that shall be collected into a metric report.
The collection type for the corresponding metric values.
The value shall specify the collection type for the corresponding metric values.
A schedule for collecting metric values.

If present, A metric values collected starting at each scheduled interval and for the time specified by Duration. No more than Schedule.MaxOccurrences values shall be collected for this metric. If not present, the corresponding metric values shall be collected when the related metric report is retrieved.
This property specifies what action is perform when a metric report resource is generated.
The value of this property shall specify the actions to perform when the metric report resource is generated. The options are transmit an event or create a metric report resource.
This property specifies what action is perform when a metric report resource is updated. Namely, overwrite, append, or create new report resource).
The value of this property shall specify the action to perform when the metric report resource is updated and the ReportActions contains a value of 'Log'.
Wildcards used to replace values in MetricProperties array property.
The property shall contain an array of wildcards and their replacements strings, which are to appliced to the MetricProperties array property.
Specifies a list of metric properties to include in the metric report.

This property shall list the metric properties to include in the metric report. Each entry is URI with wildcards. The wildcards are enclosed by curly braces. The full list of metric properties to include in the metric report shall constructed by replacing wildcards with the value in the Wildcard property.
After processing Wildcard replacement values, each value shall resolve to an OData conformant URI to a property in an entity.
Specifies a list of metrics to include in the metric report. The metrics may include metric properties or calculations applied to a metric property.
The property shall specify a list of metrics to include in the metric report. The metrics may include metric properties or calculations applied to a metric property.
References the related MetricReport.
The available actions for this resource.
The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
Contains a list of wildcards and their substitution values.
Each wildcard shall have a corresponding entry in this list element. Each entry shall specified the wildcard and its substitution values.
The name of Wildcard.
This property shall contain a name for a Wildcard for a key.
An array of Key values to substitute for the wildcard.
If the value is an empty string, then the server shall substitute every current key. Each not empty key value shall be substituted for the wildcard.
Defines the use of a set of properties as metrics.
Defines the use of a set of properties as metrics.
A collection of URI for the properties on which this metric is collected.

Each value may contain one or more Wildcard names enclosed in curly braces. Wildcard value entries shall be substituted for each Wildcard name found. If two or more wild names are found, the same Wildcard index is used for each in one substitution pass. After substituting the WildCard values entries, each value shall be a URI for a property in a resource that matches a property declaration in the corresponding MetricDefinition.
After processing Wildcard replacement values, each value shall resolve to an OData conformant URI to a property in an entity.
Function to perform over each sample.
If present, the value shall define the function to apply over the collection duration.
The duration of the collection for each metric value.
The value shall be the interval over which this metric value is be computed. The value shall conform to the Redfish Duration format.
Time scope for collecting the corresponding metric values.
The value shall specify the time scope for collecting the corresponding metric values.
Indicates when the metric report is generated.
The value shall specify when the metric report is generated.
The metric report is generated at a periodic time interval, specified in the Schedule property.
The metric report is generated when any of the metric values change.
The metric report is generated when a HTTP GET is performed on the specified metric report.
Upon a trigger, record in a log.
Upon a trigger send an Alert event.
When a metric report is updated, overwrite the specified metric report resource.
When a metric report is updated, append to the specified metric report resource.
When a metric report is updated, create a new metric report resource, whose resource name is the metric report resource name concatenated with the timestamp.
The metric is calculated as the average of a metric reading over a sliding time interval.
The metric shall be calculated as the average of a metric reading over a sliding time interval. The time interval shall be the value of the CalculationTimeInterval property.
The metric is calculated as the maximum value of a metric reading over during a time interval.
The metric shall be calculated as the maximum of a metric reading over a sliding time interval. The time interval shall be the value of the CalculationTimeInterval property.
The metric is calculated as the minimum value of a metric reading over a sliding time interval.
The metric shall be calculated as the minimum of a metric reading over a sliding time interval. The time interval shall be the value of the CalculationTimeInterval property.
The metric is calculated as the sum of the values over a sliding time interval.
The metric shall be calculated as the sum of the the specified metric reading over a sliding time interval. The time interval shall be the value of the CalculationTimeInterval property.
The time scope of the related metric values.
The time scope of the corresponding metric values. If not present, the time scope was not qualified by the metric designer, or is unknown to the provider.
The corresponding metric values apply to a point in time. On the corresponding metric value instances, TimeStamp shall specify the point in time and Duration shall not be present.
The corresponding metric values apply to a time interval. On the corresponding metric value instances, TimeStamp shall specify the end of the time interval and Duration shall specify its duration.

The corresponding metric values apply to a time interval that began at the startup of the measured resource (i.e. the Resources associated by Links.MetricDefinitionForResources). On the corresponding metric value instances, TimeStamp shall specify the end of the time interval. If Duration is not present the startup time of the measured resource is unknown. Otherwise, Duration shall specifies the duration between startup of the resource and TimeStamp.
The available actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
